team11.core.utils

Class ActionRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • team11.core.utils.ActionRobot

  • public class ActionRobot
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides an interface layer between the agents and the server which is the extension enabled in the Google's Chrome web browser.
    Author:
    Chris N. Hartley (cnhartle@calpoly.edu)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MOUSE_WHEEL_DOWN
      Integer that represents the mouse wheel action of scrolling downwards.
      static int MOUSE_WHEEL_UP
      Integer that represents the mouse wheel action of scrolling upwards.
      static Proxy proxy
      The Proxy connection for this implementation to communicate to the Angry Birds server extension enabled in Google's Chrome web browser.
      static int proxyPort
      The Proxy's port number to connect through.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ActionRobot()
      Constructor for an instance of this ActionRobot.

      Sends a mouse drag message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse being dragged from Point p1 to Point p2.

      • ActionRobot

        public ActionRobot()
        Constructor for an instance of this ActionRobot. If the Proxy, static proxy, connection has not been initialized this will initialize it on the port number, static proxyPort.

    • Method Detail

      • click

        @Deprecated
public void click()
        Deprecated. 
        Replaced with doClick().

      • doClick

        public static final java.lang.Object doClick()
        Sends a click message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse click at (0, 0). And returns the Object returned from the sendProxyClickMessage method.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from sending the click message to the proxy.
        See Also:
        sendProxyClickMessage(int, int)

      • doClick

        public static final java.lang.Object doClick(int x,
                       int y)
        Sends a click message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse click at (x, y). And returns the Object returned from the sendProxyClickMessage method.
        Parameters:
        x - the X-coordinate to click at.
        y - the Y-coordinate to click at.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from sending the click message to the proxy.
        See Also:
        sendProxyClickMessage(int, int)

      • doClick

        public static final java.lang.Object doClick(java.awt.Point pt)
        Sends a click message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse click at the specified Point. And returns the Object returned from the sendProxyClickMessage method.
        Parameters:
        pt - the Point to click at.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from sending the click message to the proxy.
        See Also:
        sendProxyClickMessage(int, int)

      • drag

        @Deprecated
public void drag()
        Deprecated. 
        Replaced with doDrag().

      • doDrag

        public static final java.lang.Object doDrag()
        Sends a mouse drag message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse being dragged from (0, 0) to (0, 0). And returns the Object returned from the sendProxyDragMessage method.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from sending the drag message to the proxy.
        See Also:
        sendProxyDragMessage(int, int, int, int)

      • doDrag

        public static final java.lang.Object doDrag(int x,
                      int y,
                      int dx,
                      int dy)
        Sends a mouse drag message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse being dragged from (x, y) to (x + dx, y + dy). And returns the Object returned from the sendProxyDragMessage method.
        Parameters:
        x - the X-coordinate to start dragging from.
        y - the Y-coordinate to start dragging from.
        dx - the change in the X-coordinates to drag to.
        dy - the change in the Y-coordinates to drag to.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from sending the drag message to the proxy.
        See Also:
        sendProxyDragMessage(int, int, int, int)

      • doDrag

        public static final java.lang.Object doDrag(java.awt.Point p1,
                      java.awt.Point p2)
        Sends a mouse drag message through the proxy to the game server to simulate a mouse being dragged from Point p1 to Point p2. And returns the Object returned from the sendProxyDragMessage method.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the Point to starting dragging from.
        p2 - the Point to drag to.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from sending the drag message to the proxy.
        See Also:
        sendProxyDragMessage(int, int, int, int)

      • doMouseWheelUp

        public static final java.lang.Object doMouseWheelUp()
        Returns the Object returned from sending the a mouse wheel message through to the game server to simulate the mouse wheel scrolling in the "up" direction.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from the proxy for the mouse wheel message requested.
        See Also:
        MOUSE_WHEEL_UP, sendProxyMouseWheelMessage(int)

      • doMouseWheelDown

        public static final java.lang.Object doMouseWheelDown()
        Returns the Object returned from sending the a mouse wheel message through to the game server to simulate the mouse wheel scrolling in the "down" direction.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from the proxy for the mouse wheel message requested.
        See Also:
        MOUSE_WHEEL_DOWN, sendProxyMouseWheelMessage(int)

      • doScreenShot

        public static final java.awt.image.BufferedImage doScreenShot()
        Returns a BufferedImage of the screenshot for the Angry Birds game by calling the sendProxyScreenshotMessage() and building the image based on the byte array returned.
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage of the current screenshot of the game.
        See Also:
        sendProxyScreenshotMessage()

      • shootWithStateInfoReturned

        public GameStateExtractor.GameState shootWithStateInfoReturned(java.util.List<Shot> shots)
        Returns the GameStateExtractor.GameState of the game after shooting the specified Shots contained in the List<Shot> parameter.
        Parameters:
        shots - the List of type Shot to be fired.
        Returns:
        the GameStateExtractor.GameState after firing the specified Shots.

      • loadLevel

        public void loadLevel(int level)
        Attempts to load the specified level through the load level schema.
        Parameters:
        level - the int specifying the level to attempt to load.
        See Also:
        LoadingLevelSchema.loadLevel(int)

      • isPlaying

        public static final boolean isPlaying()
        Returns true when the current game state is set to "playing". This is the same as calling: isGameState(GameState.PLAYING).
        Returns:
        true when the current game state is set to "playing"; otherwise, returns false.
        See Also:
        GameStateExtractor.GameState.PLAYING

      • isPlaying

        public static final boolean isPlaying(GameStateExtractor.GameState state)
        Returns true if the specified GameStateExtractor.GameState is equal to the game state "playing", GameState.PLAYING.
        Parameters:
        state - the game state to be checked if "playing".
        Returns:
        true if the specified game state is "playing".
        See Also:
        GameStateExtractor.GameState.PLAYING

      • isWon

        public static final boolean isWon()
        Returns true when the current game state is set to "won". This is the same as calling: isGameState(GameState.WON).
        Returns:
        true when the current game state is set to "won"; otherwise, returns false.
        See Also:
        GameStateExtractor.GameState.WON

      • waitForPlayingState

        public static final boolean waitForPlayingState()
        Returns a boolean value if the game state is "playing" after waiting for three attempts and sleeping between each for roughly three seconds. If the game state is set to "playing" initially this will return immediately with the value of true.
        Returns:
        true when the game state is set to "playing" after waiting for multiple attempts.

      • checkState

        @Deprecated
public static GameStateExtractor.GameState checkState()
        Deprecated. 
        Replaced with doDrag().

      • getCurrentGameState

        public static final GameStateExtractor.GameState getCurrentGameState()
        Returns the current game state after grabbing a new screenshot to analyze from the GameStateExtractor. This method will create a new instance of the GameStateExtractor and capture a new instance of the screen with doScreenShot().
        Returns:
        the current GameStateExtractor.GameState.

      • getCurrentScore

        public static final int getCurrentScore()
        Returns the current game score from either the game "playing" or "won" states. If the game state does not contain a current score, then -1 will be returned.
        Returns:
        the current score of the game from either the "playing" or "won" game states.

      • fullyZoomOut

        public static final void fullyZoomOut()
        Attempts to zoom the game view out so that the entire game is visible. This method is equivalent to calling: zoomOut(10).
        See Also:
        zoomOut(int)

      • zoomOut

        public static final void zoomOut(int scrollCount)
        Attempts to zoom out by invoking the #doMouseWheelUp() action repetitively by the specified scrollCount.
        Parameters:
        scrollCount - the int number of times to call the #doMouseWheelUp() method.
        See Also:
        doMouseWheelUp()

      • restartLevel

        public void restartLevel()
        Attempts to restart the current level in the Angry Birds game.

      • isGameState

        public static final boolean isGameState(GameStateExtractor.GameState state)
        Returns true if the current game state of the Angry Birds game equals the specified game state. If the game state passed is null or any other game state than the current game state of the game.
        Parameters:
        state - the game state to compare against the current game state.
        Returns:
        true if the current game state equals the specified game state; otherwise, returns false.
        See Also:
        GameStateExtractor.GameState

      • GoFromMainMenuToLevelSelection

        public static final void GoFromMainMenuToLevelSelection()
        Method to move from the main menu in the Angry Birds game to the episode selection menu and proceed to the level selection menu.

      • sendProxyClickMessage

        public static final java.lang.Object sendProxyClickMessage(int x,
                                     int y)
        Sends a mouse click message through to the game server to simulate a mouse being clicked at the specified point, (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - the X-coordinate to click at.
        y - the Y-coordinate to click at.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from the proxy for the mouse click message requested.
        Throws:
        NullPointException - if the proxy is not defined.
        See Also:
        ProxyClickMessage

      • sendProxyDragMessage

        public static final java.lang.Object sendProxyDragMessage(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int dx,
                                    int dy)
        Sends a mouse drag message through to the game server to simulate a mouse click and drag action. The mouse should be pressed at the specified (x, y) coordinates and dragged by the change in the X direction, dx, and Y direction, dy.
        Parameters:
        x - the initial X-coordinate to drag from.
        y - the initial Y-coordinate to drag from.
        dx - the change in the X direction from the initial point.
        dy - the change in the Y direction from the initial point.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from the proxy for the mouse drag message requested.
        Throws:
        NullPointException - if the proxy is not defined.
        See Also:
        ProxyClickMessage

      • sendProxyMouseWheelMessage

        public static final java.lang.Object sendProxyMouseWheelMessage(int direction)
        Sends the a mouse wheel message through to the game server to simulate the mouse wheel scrolling in the direction specified. The direction is an int specifying which direction to scroll the mouse wheel. As long as the value is greater than zero, the MOUSE_WHEEL_DOWN field is used. And if the value is less than zero, the MOUSE_WHEEL_UP field is used. If the value equals zero, nothing is sent to the proxy server and null is returned.
        Parameters:
        direction - an int specifying the direction to scroll the mouse wheel.
        Returns:
        the Object returned from the proxy for the mouse wheel message requested.
        Throws:
        NullPointException - if the proxy is not defined.
        See Also:
        ProxyMouseWheelMessage

      • sendProxyScreenshotMessage

        public static final byte[] sendProxyScreenshotMessage()
        Sends a screenshot message request through to the game server to take a screenshot of the current game viewable area. This returns the byte array for the screenshot.
        Returns:
        the array of bytes which makes up the screenshot image.
        Throws:
        NullPointException - if the proxy is not defined.
        See Also:
        ProxyScreenshotMessage

      • sleep

        public static final void sleep(long millis)
        Attempts to sleep the current Thread for the specified number of milliseconds. No exceptions are thrown if interrupted and if the number of milliseconds is less than or equal to zero.
        Parameters:
        millis - the number of milliseconds to sleep for.
